Articles.Content:
This is a bit of a side project, angusmcbeth asked if it is possible to make a landing leg out of a wheel collider. I said impossible without plugins. Then I learned to make plugins...

Update 21/11/2013

Updated cfg for 0.22. Under nodes survivability and adv. landing.

Update 05/09/2013

Finally finished the heavy duty version:

Designed for 25-40T landers, 0.8m travel.

Download link updated below for both parts.

Update 11/08/2013

Tested to work with 0.21, no changes needed

V1.1

V1.0

This has a travel of 0.6m, and will cushion the stock 2 stage lander below 10m/s. Also, reduced contact friction means it is more likely to slide with high lateral velocity than topple over.

Remember the model in the VAB is in the fully retracted position.

V1.1

Added retraction action (press G or use landing gear button)

Added incremental raise/lower action (right click or use action group)

Now you can manually level your craft on a slope!

Increased size of skid (only graphical difference)

Included source code

Issues:

Because it's based on the wheel module, the default wheel actions still show up in the menus, they don't do anything, just ignore them for now.

V1.0

Initial release

Direct download link: V1.2 (for 0.22)

https://sites.google.com/site/zitronfiles/LandingStrut022.zip

SpacePort: V1.0

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/alandinglegwithsuspension/

License:

There is no license, you can do whatever you want with my parts and code.

Edited November 21, 2013 by zitronen
